intro: Hymenoxys biennis, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a herbaceous plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its bright orange to red flower heads, which are composed of numerous small, tubular florets arranged in a radiate pattern. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are alternate along the stem. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Hymenoxys biennis is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers.
